reviews.review_msg: He is a bit old, which means lectures can often be a bit slow. However, he does pay a lot of attention to details, and tries to answer interesting questions students have in class.
he gave me A+  so hes my king

Lecture slides explain things badly and he just reads off of them the whole time. Assignment guidelines, sample outputs, and due dates also keep getting changed, requiring re-submissions. Midterm questions were printed weird so it was hard to find where the multiple choice answers actually were. Everything is disorganized, and wastes your time.
shows up to office hours late and ends them early. in class he just reads off slides.
Data mining is Martin's bread and butter. Must take course when he is teaching it.
Good experience
final median 55 and he did not curved
To the people commented below, exam is tomorrow. How do you know your letter grade already?

Avoid him , he's a master of jargons... He might be a "nice" guy, but at this age he's not good as prof. He can't explain materials clearly, lecture notes are full of jargons ... John edgar is your only good prof for cmpt 354

Very nice guy. Sometimes could be a little more clear on lectures but he knows what he is talking about and is happy to answer questions. I got the sense he wanted more class participation. Also some of his slides use kind of outdated SQL practices but he is fairly lenient on tests so it's fine.

to be honest, at this age he shouldn't teach anymore. I can't even understand what he's saying in lectures, mostly due to his age and accent. He's mostly read from lecture slides, and very useless lectures. I have to copy each of his slides to chatgpt to explain me what exactly this prof is saying. Avoid him, not much I learned from this course...

Genuinely just not a great professor. There was homework every single week of the semester, each time, new homework was released the day before the previous was due. Just feels like poor care for the students.

I asked him to put complete lecture slides on the canvas page and he refused stating that students must come to class. Exams are 8/10 hard.
He knows his stuff and it's interesting to learn from the guy who invented DBSCAN. The average for all the midterms were < 50% though...

Dr. Ester isn't charismatic, but he is caring and knowledgeable.

For a world-renowned Computer Scientist, I was surprised to hear him asking how we mere undergrads were doing every lecture.

The course requires intellectual interest. If not interested in Data Mining, you'll fall asleep.

Otherwise, you'll be learning from the best.
terrrible!

Always goes overtime and short 5 min breaks. Do not take with class immediately after, unless in same room.
Many technical slides, and does not cover in depth. I learned nearly nothing during lectures.
Many technical difficulties. Many computer issues, which distracts learning.
Brutal marking on short answer on midterms.

Extremely time consuming with multiple midterms, group project and multiple assignments. Each of the assignments and group project milestones take at least a few days to finish and are grueling to finish or even get working (first "easy"ssignment code took over 300 lines of code for me and 5 days of working it on it all day) unreal expectations

Dr. Ester authored some of the seminal papers in Data Mining in the past, so he's def very knowledgeable. The class is not the most engaging however, sometimes we're just given algorithms without any theoretical motivation. Open-book quiz and final project are extremely easy - overall a grade booster as an online class.

Dr Ester is the best professor I have ever seen. He respects every student in his class. And he is willing to give students partial marks even the answer is not correct. His lecture is boring but the exam is very fair, everything is from either slides or assignments. I would take more database topic courses with him.
SOOOOOOO BORING, he is smart and know everything but just not good at teaching, bad lecture bad slices, I stopped attending the lecture after midterm, just learn by yourself to get an easy A

Lectures are hard to follow for the same reasons from post below me. A lot of homework, 1 paper assignment + 1 programming assignment alternating every week for a total of 5 each. Both are hard so start early and be ready to learn R very quickly. Midterm/Final 45% sim to paper assignments. Don't be shy to ask questions! Email/office hours are key.

I believe he knows well about data mining and he treats students with respect. But he can not teach. He does not know how to explain a topic to a novice. He tries to teach too much advanced algorithms and theories without laying a solid foundation. If the class was taught by anyone else, I would have learned so much more and better. Avoid Dr. Ester

Martin is a renowned scholar in Data mining. I think taking 459 from him is one of the best ways to fully utilize the CS education at SFU. Although his lectures are a little bit boring, and there are too many assignments, you can learn a lot of things from this course. "HE KNOWS THE SUBJECT VERY WELL" This is all I can say here.

Prof has poor teaching skills but he's a nice guy. Don't take this course if your background ain't biomedical or lack understanding of Machine learning algorithms. Prof knowledge is not so good in ML side and good in biomed side. Seminar based course. I wasn't from biomed, so I felt it was very difficult to understand prof or fellow presentations

He is a very knowledgeable professor from the School of Computing Science and he is always willing to help students to get thru the toughest part of the course. CMPT 459 (Data Mining) is a hot topic in the tech. industry right now and Dr. Ester is one of the best prof. you should take this course with.
VERY CARING AND NICE. SUPER INTELLIGENT. He even taught us some Algorithms he developed 21 years ago.

The textbook and his lecture notes sometimes dont match. He makes many mistakes. His exam/assn questions are ambiguous and marking is sometimes done on a strict basis even though there could be multiple right answers. He is very boring. On the plus side he's not too hard and exams are open book.
I find his classes boring.  I rarely attended class. He is one of the easiest instructors that I have had at SFU.  Exams are open book and questions were similar to the assignments.

Good prof. Very willing to help and takes student feedback into account. Posts very detailed notes online. Assignments (weekly) range from easy to fair. Exams are open book. Tough midterm (too long!), okay final. Classes always go overtime. Contrary to what others have said, I *would* take another class with him.

If you learn well from the textbook, you will do OK. His assignments and exams are fair, but his teaching is quite bad. It's unfortunate too because he's a nice guy and wants everyone to do well. And yes, he goes over time every lecture so don't take a class right after his class.

Exams are extremely long. Don't expect to finish in time. Beware of keeners in the class. They tend to get him off track for a very long time. Our review class, which was suppose to REVIEW the semester.. ended up only covering 3 questions in 1 section.. IN TWO DAYS. Thanks WM, black coat, squeaky kid, durrr kid. You know who you are.

Horrible prof ever. I am ready to quit his lecture and wait another year for someone else. Lectures extremely boring, midterm & final - never enough time to complete, assignments easy but not enough percentage on total marks. Marking schemes never fair!! Please take my advise and avoid him.

Nice guy, lectures are boring, exams open-book, assignment grades nice, but midterm fatal. listening to him is like trying to understand ****. It shouldnt be too hard to get a good grade in his class though.

Smart guy BUT, useless when it comes to teaching. Fortunatly the material is easy and the assignments aren't too bad. However, DON'T expect to learn ANYTHING from him. His notes are often incorrect so don't follow them. Oh yeah, test, can't judge the amount of time you need to write a test so you are often trying to write a 2 hour midterm in 1 hour

Knows what he is talking about, but have trouble (at certain times) in teaching it. Hands out alot of assign. but are relatively easy to do. Midterm and final exam are reasonable, but really has a tough time judging amount of time required to finish it. Overall, a decent prof that knows his stuff.
No Comments
No Comments

Most boring prof EVER, he also has attitude problem.
 But his assns and exams are pretty easy
He sucks, can't teach
he knows his stuff, but I found it to be a hard class even though I thought I understood everything
Unreasonably long midterm for 50 min. Reasonable final with open book, expect a lots of writing though. WILL definitely take him for 454.
No so good at explaining. Lectures are boring. Open book exam. I wouldn't take another class with him.
Easy assignment and exam, but he can't teach
OPEN BOOK exam, reasonable assign, knowledgeable!!
